intro: Pfeiffera miyagawae, commonly known as the Miyagawa's pfeiffera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
